content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.  
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.  
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.  
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5)

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research (status: NO_POWER).  
• Electricity Group comprising:
 – Existing small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).  
 – Additional poles placed during recent steps:
  • At (x=-7.5, y=16.5) – placed and connected in step 1280.  
  • At (x=-10.5, y=18.5) – placed in step 1283; connection attempt failed.  
  • At (x=-8.5, y=13.5) – placed in step 1286 and successfully connected in step 1287.
• Merged network poles at (x=-17.5, y=13.5) and (x=-17.5, y=16.5).  
• Dual PipeGroups forming the fluid network:
 – Group 1: positions (x=-10.5, y=16.5) and (x=-12.5, y=18.5).  
 – Group 2: positions (x=-8.5, y=20.5) and (x=-2.5, y=21.5).  
• Steam Engines:
 – Steam engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5) connected via the pole at (x=-17.5, y=16.5).  
 – Steam engine at (x=-14.5, y=13.5) connected via the pole at (x=-17.5, y=13.5).  
 – Steam engine at (x=7.5, y=35.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED).  
 – Steam engine at (x=8.5, y=20.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED).

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) reconfigured for Iron Gear Wheel production.  
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).  
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5).  
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5).  
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).  
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5).  
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).  
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5).  
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).  
• Belt Source Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.  
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.  
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).  
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).  
• Manual Transport Belt Chain comprising:
 – Horizontal belt segments at (x=7.5, y=15.5) and (x=8.5, y=15.5) [blocked placement at (x=6.5, y=15.5)].  
 – Vertical belt segments at (x=8.5, y=14.5), (x=8.5, y=13.5), (x=8.5, y=12.5) and (x=8.5, y=11.5) [occupancy error at (x=8.5, y=10.5)].  
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).  
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem comprising:
 – Burner Inserters at (x=6.5, y=9.5), (x=7.5, y=9.5) and (x=8.5, y=9.5) operating at reduced fuel levels.  
 – Additional Burner Inserters at (x=3.5, y=14.5) and (x=5.5, y=14.5).

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-30.5, y=37.5).  
• Boiler at (x=-29.0, y=33.5).  
• Pipe Connection re-established via a new PipeGroup starting at (x=-30.5, y=31.5) and continuing through positions (x=-30.5, y=34.5), (x=-30.5, y=35.5) and (x=-30.5, y=36.5).

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Positional Occupancy:
 – Validate candidate positions for placements by ensuring sufficient clearance and confirming that target tiles are unoccupied by entities such as wooden chests or pipes.

• Pole Placement & Spacing:
 – Before placing electric poles near labs, precheck for collisions with existing poles, pipes, or other fixed structures. Adjust spacing, direction, or reference positions as needed.

• Connection Failures:
 – Confirm that required items (for example, small electric poles) are available in sufficient numbers before initiating connection attempts.  
 – Check that variables referencing electrical components are correctly assigned to prevent nil reference errors during connection operations.

• Type Handling:
 – Ensure that objects are used with appropriate methods. In particular, verify the type of position objects to avoid calling unsupported functions (e.g., calling center() on an object that is not callable).

• General Resource & Network Management:
 – Pre-calculate material requirements and verify inventory levels to mitigate errors during placement and connection procedures.  
 – Review all placement and connection parameters to reduce the incidence of conflicts and runtime errors.
